text:
<@U7SL518D6>, chrome extension has been mentioned in Dublin HubSpot bootcamp. 
Fresh :cut_of_meat: coming :grin:

So cool! Thanks for telling me!

did anyone comment on the translations? lol I’m always scared the translations might be like orcish
Nope, you can chill on that :wink:
Suggestion: the Content Setting and Content Staging are very similar and 2 out 3 times I click on the wrong one ... maybe move settings all the way to the bottom?

<@U2PDTMH53>  that’s good feedback. I’ve done that before myself.

The links are ordered based on the frequency that all users of the extension as a whole click each link.(more frequently used links are at the top)

I like listing the links in that fashion but you’re absolutely right that with those two links it’s easy to click the wrong one.

what do you think of this solution - change the label for those links.

Content staging could simply be renamed to Staging.

Content settings could be renamed to Page Settings as it goes there.

(we don’t necessarily need to change the labels for BOTH links just changing one would likely solve the issue)
so i can change the labels myself?

No, not really, I was meaning this naming change would happen for everyone.

But you basically could change the labels yourself -it just would affect everyone. The project is completely open source.
no … don’t wanna do that … i mean you should do it :slightly_smiling_face: … i might break things
so yes … having say just STAGING it’s a solution
i say relabel them all to say the same thing
that will be my donation to this project
